title: Rare ‘planetary parade’ to adorn night skies from January 21. Know significance & how to watch - ThePrint
summary:
Rare ‘planetary parade’ to adorn night skies from January 21. Know significance & how to watch

Publication Date: N/A | Source: ThePrint

A rare celestial event will adorn the night skies of India through early March, starting 21 January. Seven planets will line up for a ‘planetary parade’, some of which will be visible to the naked eye.

  • The parade begins with four visible planets: Venus, Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars.
  • By mid-February, Mercury, Neptune, and Uranus will also join.
  • The last similar event occurred in 2022.
  • NASA encourages people to observe the planets each evening this month.
“The exciting part of this parade is that most of these planets will be visible to the naked eye. You might need a telescope to view Neptune and Uranus,” - Virendra Yadav, ARIES

This planetary parade will be a wonderful opportunity for amateur astronomers and stargazers to witness a rare alignment of planets.
newTitle: Rare ‘planetary parade’ to adorn night skies from January 21. Know significance & how to watch

title: 10 sparkly images of Hubble’s Star Clusters captured by NASA - DNA India
summary:
10 Mesmerising Images of Hubble’s Star Clusters Captured by NASA

Date: Jan 19, 2025
Source: DNA

This article showcases stunning images captured by NASA’s Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting various star clusters and their beauty.

  • Star cluster Liller 1 illuminated by thousands of stars.
  • Trumpler 14 hosts some of the most massive stars in our galaxy.
  • Caldwell 71 features loosely bound collections of stars.
  • Terzan 4 includes many thousands of stars in Scorpius constellation.
  • The Orion Nebula’s Trapezium contains young stars through dense gases.
  • NGC 2210 is a densely packed globular cluster in the Large Magellanic Cloud.
  • Terzan 12 is a tightly bound collection of stars.
  • NGC 6652 sparkles with glittering stars.
  • NGC 6544 shows teeming stars captured from Hubble.
  • NGC 6325 features a densely packed globular cluster.
newTitle: 10 Mesmerising Images of Hubble’s Star Clusters Captured by NASA

Astronomers Warn of Disaster as Light Pollution Looms Over Global Telescope Site - Indian Defence Review
summary:
Astronomers Warn of Disaster as Light Pollution Looms Over Global Telescope Site

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: Not specified

Astronomers express concerns over the INNA renewable energy project proposed by AES Energy, which may increase light pollution at the Paranal Observatory, jeopardizing vital astronomical research.

  • INNA could increase light pollution by up to 10%.
  • The observatory plays a crucial role in major astronomical discoveries.
  • The project is situated close to the Very Large Telescope (VLT) and the upcoming Extremely Large Telescope (ELT).
  • The Atacama Desert's unique conditions are irreplaceable for stargazing and scientific observation.
“The brightness of the sky is going to increase by up to 10% from this project, and that is enough to make a difference between the best observatory in the world and an average observing place.” - Xavier Barcons

The potential light pollution could severely compromise future astronomical discoveries and highlights a conflict between energy development and environmental preservation.
newTitle: Astronomers Warn of Light Pollution Threatening Global Telescope Site

title: RNA, not DNA, is the main cause of acute sunburn - The Hindu
summary:
RNA, not DNA, is the main cause of acute sunburn

Published: January 18, 2025 - Source: Molecular Cell

New research reveals that acute sunburn is primarily caused by damage to RNA, rather than DNA, challenging previous beliefs about the effects of UV radiation on skin.

  • The study was conducted on both mice and human skin cells.
  • Damage to messenger RNA (mRNA) triggers inflammation via a protein known as ZAK-alpha.
  • The findings were published in the journal Molecular Cell.
“We found that the first thing the cells respond to after being exposed to UV radiation is damage to the RNA, and that this is what triggers cell death and inflammation of the skin.” - Dr. Simon Bekker-Jensen

This research shifts the understanding of skin responses to UV radiation and highlights the importance of ribosomes and the ZAK gene in skin reactions.
newTitle: RNA, not DNA, is the main cause of acute sunburn

title: Bengaluru To Witness Rare Six-Planet Alignment In Night Sky Until February 13 | Details - Jagran English
NASA's Mars Mission at a crossroads: Will Donald Trump’s administration fund the historic rock return from - The Economic Times
summary:
NASA's Mars Sample Return Mission Faces Critical Decision as Trump Administration Steps In

Publication Date: Not Provided Source: Not Provided

Nasa’s mission to return Martian rocks to Earth is at a crucial crossroads with the incoming Trump administration. The future of this historic project, which could reveal vital information about Mars, relies on funding decisions.

  • The Perseverance rover has collected over two dozen Martian samples in Jezero Crater since its landing in February 2021.
  • Nasa proposes two budget-friendly plans for the sample return, estimated between $6 and $7 billion.
  • The mission aims to be the first to return rocks from another planet, providing insights into Mars’ geological history and potential past life.
  • The NASA Administrator position is likely to go to Jared Isaacman, which could influence the mission’s direction.
  • Despite past challenges, the rover continues to prospect for more valuable samples as the decision looms.
“We want to bring those back as quickly as possible to study them in state-of-the-art facilities.” - Nicola Fox, NASA’s associate administrator

The outcome of the Mars Sample Return mission's planning and execution could have lasting implications for future space exploration.
newTitle: NASA's Mars Sample Return Mission Faces Critical Decision as Trump Administration Steps In

title: NASA Posts Breathtaking Image Of Remnants Of Supernova - Free Press Journal
summary:
NASA Posts Breathtaking Image Of Remnants Of Supernova

Publication Date: January 18, 2025Source: NASA

The image is a stunning representation of Cassiopeia A, remnants of a supernova captured by NASA's James Webb Space Telescope, showcasing its capability to photograph in infrared light.

  • The image reveals intricate details of the supernova remnant.
  • NASA highlights the unique features captured by JWST, which differ from Hubble's capabilities.
  • Experts express astonishment at the level of detail visible in the image.
“We were pretty shocked to see this level of detail,” said Jacob Jencson of Caltech/IPAC.

This captivating image emphasizes the advancements in space observation technology and enriches our understanding of cosmic events.
newTitle: NASA Posts Breathtaking Image Of Remnants Of Supernova

title: New kind of skeletal tissue found in California - Dynamite News
Rare meteorite strike sound captured on Canada home's doorbell camera | Watch viral video | Today News - Mint
summary:
Rare meteorite strike sound captured on Canada home’s doorbell camera | Watch viral video

Date: September 2023 | Source: Live Mint

A rare moment was captured on camera in Charlottetown City, Canada, when a rock from space fell to Earth. A doorbell camera on a Canadian home recorded the meteorite hitting Earth as it crashed into a walkway.

Key Points:

  • The incident occurred in July last year.
  • A couple returned home to find their walkway littered with debris.
  • The meteorite was confirmed to be of interstellar origins by the University of Alberta.
  • It marked a significant first in meteorite documentation with both video and sound.
  • The space rock has been named Charlottetown.
“As far as we know — it is the first time that a meteorite falling to Earth has been recorded on video, with sound,” said Chris Herd, geologist.

This unique event offers new insights into meteorite strikes and has generated significant interest.
newTitle: Rare meteorite strike sound captured on Canada home’s doorbell camera | Watch viral video

title: SpaceX Falcon 9 Launches Blue Ghost and Resilience Lunar Landers from Kennedy Space Center - AffairsCloud.com
summary:
SpaceX Falcon 9 Launches Blue Ghost and Resilience Lunar Landers from Kennedy Space Center

Date: January 15, 2025 | Source: AffairsCloud

On January 15, 2025, a SpaceX Falcon 9 rocket successfully launched from Kennedy Space Center, carrying two lunar landers: Blue Ghost and Resilience.

  • The Blue Ghost is led by Firefly Aerospace from Texas, while Resilience is spearheaded by ispace Inc from Tokyo, Japan.
  • Blue Ghost is expected to take about 45 days to reach the Moon, targeting a landing on March 2, 2025.
  • The Resilience mission focuses on deploying innovative technologies and cultural payloads, taking about four to five months to reach the Moon.

Key operations of Blue Ghost include the operation of NASA payloads and monitoring of lunar conditions, while Resilience will carry a variety of scientific and cultural instruments.

These efforts are key milestones in NASA’s goal to develop a lunar economy and support future human exploration under the Artemis program.

Both missions face significant challenges in navigating the lunar surface without the use of parachutes due to the lack of atmosphere.
newTitle: SpaceX Falcon 9 Launches Blue Ghost and Resilience Lunar Landers from Kennedy Space Center

title: Alert! NASA Warns Of Massive 820-Ft Stadium-Sized Asteroid Speeding Towards Earth Tomorrow: Check Time, Speed - Times Now
summary:
NASA Warns of Massive Asteroid 2024 WY70 Approaching Earth

Publication Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: NASA

A massive asteroid, named 2024 WY70, is on a close approach to Earth, raising concerns due to its significant size and speed.

  • The asteroid measures 820 feet (250 meters) in diameter, about the size of a stadium.
  • It is moving towards Earth at a speed of 36,606 km/h.
  • 2024 WY70 will pass at a distance of 6.3 million kilometers from Earth on January 18, 2025, at 10:42 PM UTC.
  • This asteroid is classified as a potentially hazardous asteroid (PHA).
  • NASA has stated that there’s no immediate threat posed by this asteroid.
If 2024 WY70 were to collide with Earth, it could unleash energy equivalent to hundreds of nuclear bombs, causing widespread devastation.

This close approach reiterates the importance of monitoring near-Earth objects to mitigate risks in the future.
newTitle: NASA Warns of Massive Asteroid 2024 WY70 Approaching Earth

title: New Insights into Predicting Solar Flares - Observer Voice
Watch: Doorbell camera captures sound of meteorite strike in Canada - India Today
summary:
Doorbell Camera Records Rare Meteorite Strike in Canada

Published On: Jan 18, 2025 By: Devika Bhattacharya

A Canadian homeowner captured rare video of a meteorite striking his walkway, producing debris and sound. The incident occurred last July when a meteorite, estimated to be between a golf ball and baseball size, left a small crater.

  • The meteorite created a loud bang and a cloud of dust.
  • Joe Velaidum and his partner were initially puzzled by the debris.
  • The doorbell camera footage helped confirm the event.
  • The meteorite has been named 'Charlottetown' and classified as an ordinary chondrite.
  • This is believed to be the first recorded instance of a meteorite impact caught on video with sound.
  • Nasa reports that 43 tonnes of space debris hit Earth daily.
“Had I stayed in that very spot for just a minute or two longer, I'd certainly have been struck and probably killed by this meteorite.” - Joe Velaidum

This event underscores the rarity and scientific significance of meteorite strikes, especially when captured in such detail.
newTitle: Doorbell Camera Records Rare Meteorite Strike in Canada

title: Spectacular Meteorite Crash: Doorbell Camera Captures First-Ever Historic Sound | WATCH - Republic World
Bean-Shaped Wonders : What Secrets Lie Beneath Mars' Frozen Sand Dunes? - Boldsky
summary:
Bean-Shaped Wonders: What Secrets Lie Beneath Mars' Frozen Sand Dunes?

Date: Saturday, January 18, 2025

Source: Boldsky

NASA's Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter has captured striking images of frozen dune formations on Mars, providing key insights into the Martian environment.

  • The dunes resemble kidney beans and are covered in carbon dioxide frost.
  • Unlike Earth’s dunes, these remain frozen during winter.
  • Carbon dioxide frost plays a significant role in shaping Mars' atmosphere.
  • The frozen dunes may provide clues about Mars' potential to support life.
  • Seasonal changes affect the Martian landscape, allowing scientists to observe environmental responses.
  • Research on Mars’ climatic conditions can be applied to other celestial bodies.
“These frozen formations are more than just an interesting sight—they are a key to understanding Mars' past and its potential to support life.”

In conclusion, the study of Mars' frozen sand dunes can unlock valuable secrets about the planet's climate and its capability to sustain life, propelling our understanding of extraterrestrial existence.
newTitle: Exploring Mars' Frozen Sand Dunes: Insights into Climate and Life Potential

title: James Webb Space Telescope Unveils Hidden Interstellar Wonders of Supernova Cassiopeia A - Gadgets 360
summary:
James Webb Space Telescope Unveils Hidden Supernova Cassiopeia A

Publication Date: January 2025 | Source: Gadgets 360

The James Webb Space Telescope (JWST) has illuminated the centuries-old supernova Cassiopeia A, revealing intricate structures in the interstellar medium and providing unprecedented insights into the dynamics of interstellar material located 11,000 light-years away.

  • The JWST captured glowing gas and dust from the aftermath of the supernova explosion.
  • Findings were presented at the 245th American Astronomical Society (AAS) conference.
  • The telescope's infrared capabilities revealed complex patterns and three-dimensional structures in interstellar material.
  • The research helps in understanding the processes within dense, dusty regions of space.
“These observations have rapidly advanced the study of the interstellar medium, shedding light on processes that were long considered perplexing.” - Josh Peek

The detailed mapping of Cassiopeia A signifies a major advancement in understanding the physics of the interstellar medium and the role of magnetic fields in star formation.
newTitle: James Webb Space Telescope Unveils Hidden Supernova Cassiopeia A

title: WATCH: Canadian man’s doorbell camera captures audio, video of meteorite crashing Earth - The Indian Express
summary:
WATCH: Canadian man’s doorbell camera captures audio, video of meteorite crashing Earth

Date: January 18, 2025 Source: CBC News

In an extraordinary stroke of luck, Canadian man Joe Velaidum captured video and audio of a meteorite crashing to Earth—marking an unprecedented documentation of such an event.

  • Joe Velaidum was standing at the impact location just minutes before the meteorite struck.
  • The family initially doubted the meteorite's origin until experts confirmed it.
  • The meteorite is an ordinary chondrite, classified by researchers from the University of Alberta.
  • This event is notable as it is the first recorded instance of a meteorite falling with both video and sound.
  • Experts emphasize its significance as the first meteorite recorded from the province of PEI.
“As far as we know, it’s the first time that a meteorite falling to Earth has been recorded on video, with sound.” - Chris Herd, Geologist

This rare documentation provides a new perspective on the natural history of Prince Edward Island, showcasing the wonders of our universe.
newTitle: Canadian Man Captures Rare Footage of Meteorite Crash

title: How to glimpse a parade of planets in the January night sky - Deccan Chronicle
summary:
How to Glimpse a Parade of Planets in the January Night Sky

Publication Date: January 2023

Source: AP News

Six planets grace the sky this month in what’s known as a planetary parade, visible to the naked eye. The planets align on one side of the sun, offering a spectacular view for observers.

  1. Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn are visible without special equipment.
  2. Uranus and Neptune require binoculars or telescopes to spot.
  3. The best time for viewing is a few hours after sunset on clear nights.
  4. Venus and Saturn will appear especially close, just two degrees apart.
  5. Stargazing apps may enhance the viewing experience.
“It gives us a little bit better sense of our place in the solar system and the universe.” - Kevin Williams, planetarium director

As planets gradually exit through the spring, this astrological event reminds us of our place in the cosmos.
newTitle: How to Glimpse a Parade of Planets in the January Night Sky

summary:
5 Fascinating Images of Space Shared by NASA Hubble Space Telescope

Published on: January 18, 2025 by India.com

This article showcases five incredible images taken by the NASA Hubble Space Telescope, highlighting various celestial features and phenomena.

  • NASA Hubble Space Telescope reveals several hundred never before seen galaxies in its deepest-ever view, called the Hubble Deep Field.
  • An image of the globular cluster NGC 6544 displays its twinkling stars.
  • Phobos, the tiny moon of Mars, is seen on its orbit around the Red Planet.
  • NGC 4248, a beautiful spiral galaxy, is located about 24 million light-years away.
  • The stormy stellar nursery known as N159 spans over 150 light-years in this depiction.
“Thanks for reading!”

These stunning images not only captivate the imagination but also demonstrate the powerful capabilities of the Hubble Space Telescope.

title: Sound, video of meteorite hitting Earth recorded together for the ‘first time': ‘It probably would've ripped me in half' - Hindustan Times
summary:
Scientists Capture Sound and Video of Meteorite Strike for the First Time

Date: Jan 18, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

In an incredible moment, a Canadian man named Joe Velaidum recorded both audio and video of a meteorite striking Earth, which scientists believe is the first instance of such documentation.

  • Joe Velaidum was at the site of impact shortly before the meteorite hit.
  • The incident was confirmed by the University of Alberta, marking it as the first recording of a meteorite strike with both sound and video.
  • The meteorite has been named the Charlottetown Meteorite.
  • This event is significant for the scientific community, showcasing how a meteorite can land in populated areas.
“If I'd have seen it, I probably would've been standing right there, so it probably would've ripped me in half,” said Joe Velaidum.

This remarkable occurrence demonstrates the intersection of natural phenomena and technology, allowing for a unique scientific observation.
newTitle: Scientists Capture Sound and Video of Meteorite Strike for the First Time

A planet parade of Venus, Saturn, Jupiter and Mars shines in the skies this month - Central Florida Public Media (previously WMFE)
summary:
A Spectacular Planet Parade: Venus, Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars in January 2025

Published: January 17, 2025
Source: NPR

Over the next few weeks, a stunning parade of planets will glow across the night sky, putting on a celestial spectacle that both amateur and seasoned stargazers can easily observe. All month, four planets — Venus, Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars — will appear to line up and be bright enough to see with the naked eye in the first few hours after dark, according to NASA.

  • Venus and Saturn will appear very close together on Friday and Saturday.
  • Mars is at 'opposition' this month, making it appear bigger and brighter.
  • Jupiter will shine high overhead during the viewing time.
  • Uranus and Neptune can be seen through binoculars or telescopes.
"These multi-planet viewing opportunities aren't super rare, but they don't happen every year, so it's worth checking it out," - NASA

In conclusion, the planetary lineup this January offers a unique opportunity for skywatchers to witness a spectacular celestial event.
newTitle: A Spectacular Planet Parade: Venus, Saturn, Jupiter, and Mars in January 2025

title: You Can See Four Planets With The Naked Eye This Month, And Two With Binoculars - ABP Live
summary:
You Can See Four Planets With The Naked Eye This Month, And Two With Binoculars

Publication Date: January 2023 | Source: Associated Press

This month offers an exciting opportunity for astronomy enthusiasts, as four planets can be seen with the naked eye while two additional planets are visible with binoculars. This celestial event is a delightful aspect for casual stargazers as well.

  1. Planets visible to the naked eye include Venus, Mars, Jupiter, and Saturn.
  2. Uranus and Neptune can also be seen through binoculars or telescopes.
  3. A special alignment occurs, with planets appearing close to one side of the sun.
  4. Notable viewing times include January 17 and 18 when Venus and Saturn will be just two degrees apart.
  5. The planetary parade continues into February, with Mercury becoming visible later in the month.
“These multi-planet viewing opportunities aren’t super rare, but they don’t happen every year, so it’s worth checking it out.” - Preston Dyches, NASA

This planetary parade provides a rare and visually stunning opportunity for sky watchers to engage with the cosmos. Astronomers recommend visiting dark areas for the best viewing experience.
newTitle: Four Planets Visible This Month for Stargazers

title: ‘Get those rocket ships going’: where will Trump’s space odyssey lead Nasa? - The Guardian
summary:
‘Get those rocket ships going’: where will Trump’s space odyssey lead Nasa?

Publication Date: January 9, 2025 Source: The Guardian

As Donald Trump prepares to return to the White House with Elon Musk, they are planning an ambitious agenda for US spaceflight, including aspirations for human footprints on Mars. The partnership aims to make significant advancements in US space exploration and policy.

  • Trump and Musk's collaboration may influence NASA's direction significantly.
  • Trump intends to accelerate plans for a crewed Mars mission by 2028.
  • The success of the Artemis program is critical to their space agenda.
  • Potential changes to NASA's direction may face challenges due to Senate dynamics.
  • Jared Isaacman is slated to be the next NASA administrator, focusing on consensus-building.
“Elon, get those rocket ships going because we want to reach Mars before the end of my term.” – Donald Trump

The ambitions for space exploration under Trump's potential second term could lead to innovative developments, yet any real changes may be gradual and contingent upon collaboration with lawmakers and allies in the space industry.
newTitle: Trump and Musk's Ambitious Plans for US Spaceflight
